name: Coyote
subtitle: The Trickster, Fire-Bringer, Old Man Coyote
description: Coyote is one of the most important and complex figures in Native American mythology. He is simultaneously creator and destroyer, wise teacher and utter fool, sacred being and outrageous buffoon.

name: Raven
subtitle: Creator, Transformer, Trickster, Light-Bringer
description: Raven is the central figure in the mythology of Pacific Northwest Coast peoples. He shaped the world, stole the sun to bring light to humanity, and continues to transform reality through his cunning and power.

name: Spider Woman
subtitle: Na'ashjei'ii Asdzaa - Grandmother Spider, Weaver of Life
description: Spider Woman is one of the most important creator figures in the traditions of the American Southwest. She is the ancient being who wove the world into existence, taught humans the sacred art of weaving, and continues to guide those who seek wisdom.

name: Thunderbird
subtitle: Spirit of the Storm, Guardian of the Upper World
description: The Thunderbird is one of the most powerful and widespread supernatural beings in Native American traditions. This great spirit bird commands the storms - its wings create thunder, its eyes flash lightning, and its arrival heralds the life-giving rains.

name: White Buffalo Calf Woman
subtitle: Pte Ska Win - Sacred Messenger of the Lakota
description: White Buffalo Calf Woman is one of the most sacred figures in Lakota, Dakota, and Nakota spirituality. She appeared to the people bringing the sacred pipe (Chanunpa) and the seven sacred rites that form the foundation of Lakota spiritual practice.
